content.raw:
I meanwhile also made an upstream pull request for OGRE: [https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/pull/481](https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/pull/481). So the necessary change (supporting [NSOpenGLCPSurfaceOrder](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsopenglcpsurfaceorder)) should hopefully be merged before too long.

This commit should introduce no new issues building against older OGRE v1.10.x releases (I used v1.10.3 and v1.10.6 before).
content.html:
I meanwhile also made an upstream pull request for OGRE: https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/pull/481. So the necessary change (supporting NSOpenGLCPSurfaceOrder) should hopefully be merged before too long.

This commit should introduce no new issues building against older OGRE v1.10.x releases (I used v1.10.3 and v1.10.6 before).

content.raw: Hi, thanks for the contribution! We currently use a homebrew formula for [ogre1.9](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ogre1.9.rb). Perhaps you could advise on creating a formula for `ogre1.10`?
content.html: Hi, thanks for the contribution! We currently use a homebrew formula for ogre1.9. Perhaps you could advise on creating a formula for ogre1.10?

content.raw: I think this should be added to `qt_headers` since it is referenced in the public header file `GLWidget.hh`
content.html: I think this should be added to qt_headers since it is referenced in the public header file GLWidget.hh

content.raw:
With my OGRE pull request (that was meanwhile [merged upstream](https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/pull/481#event-1205679347)), the OGRE build should be significantly simpler than the [existing formula](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ogre1.9.rb). No additional patches should be required. The next release that should contain the changes should be OGRE 1.10.8.

For now, I'll just paste the cmake arguments I'm using to build OGRE from [https://github.com/fschopp/ogre/releases/tag/v1.10.7-fschopp-1](https://github.com/fschopp/ogre/releases/tag/v1.10.7-fschopp-1). I currently use this build only with Gazebo, though. Not sure if the homebrew formula needs to be more general. Let me know if you'd like me to do a PR for it.

    -DPKG_CONFIG_USE_CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=YES
    -DOGRE_BUILD_DEPENDENCIES=FALSE
    -DOGRE_BUILD_RENDERSYSTEM_GL=TRUE
    -DOGRE_BUILD_SAMPLES=FALSE
    -DOGRE_BUILD_TOOLS=FALSE
    -DOGRE_INSTALL_CMAKE=FALSE
    -DOGRE_INSTALL_DOCS=FALSE
    -DOGRE_BUILD_COMPONENT_PYTHON=FALSE
    -DCMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES=x86_64
    -DOGRE_BUILD_LIBS_AS_FRAMEWORKS=FALSE
    -DOGRE_BUILD_TYPE=${OGRE_BUILD_TYPE}

Please note that for newer OGRE versions this seems to work out of the box only with the Xcode generator, i.e., `cmake -G Xcode` . Also, `OGRE_BUILD_TYPE` needs to contain the lower-cased content of `CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE`. (Currently, the OGRE build script uses `OGRE_BUILD_TYPE` before it defines it. Should only be a problem for debug builds, though, and possibly not even on macOS.)
content.html:
With my OGRE pull request (that was meanwhile merged upstream), the OGRE build should be significantly simpler than the existing formula. No additional patches should be required. The next release that should contain the changes should be OGRE 1.10.8.

For now, I'll just paste the cmake arguments I'm using to build OGRE from https://github.com/fschopp/ogre/releases/tag/v1.10.7-fschopp-1. I currently use this build only with Gazebo, though. Not sure if the homebrew formula needs to be more general. Let me know if you'd like me to do a PR for it.

-DPKG_CONFIG_USE_CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=YES
-DOGRE_BUILD_DEPENDENCIES=FALSE
-DOGRE_BUILD_RENDERSYSTEM_GL=TRUE
-DOGRE_BUILD_SAMPLES=FALSE
-DOGRE_BUILD_TOOLS=FALSE
-DOGRE_INSTALL_CMAKE=FALSE
-DOGRE_INSTALL_DOCS=FALSE
-DOGRE_BUILD_COMPONENT_PYTHON=FALSE
-DCMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES=x86_64
-DOGRE_BUILD_LIBS_AS_FRAMEWORKS=FALSE
-DOGRE_BUILD_TYPE=${OGRE_BUILD_TYPE}

Please note that for newer OGRE versions this seems to work out of the box only with the Xcode generator, i.e., cmake -G Xcode . Also, OGRE_BUILD_TYPE needs to contain the lower-cased content of CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE. (Currently, the OGRE build script uses OGRE_BUILD_TYPE before it defines it. Should only be a problem for debug builds, though, and possibly not even on macOS.)

content.raw: Thanks for the update. I think this patch set is important – GUI plugins would be invisible/unusable on macOS otherwise. It will take a few weeks before I’ll have time to get back to this though.
content.html: Thanks for the update. I think this patch set is important – GUI plugins would be invisible/unusable on macOS otherwise. It will take a few weeks before I’ll have time to get back to this though.
